content.description: The sit start to v2 my A**. Start at the base of the arete on a left-leaning sloper rail and climb into the stand start via some heinous slopers and terrible feet.
content.protection: Two pads or so, and a spotter for the upper section.
content.location: On the Pinnacle Boulder, sit starts about 4 feet below the start of v2 my A** and about 10 feet right.

content.description: Stand start the left angling arete.  Reach high with the right hand and get a high right foot.  Lay back the arete to the left, the crux is getting up over your feet in the first few moves.  With the right beta it really is V2 (get your left foot in the high scoop.)
content.protection: Pads and spotters are not mandatory but you'll probably want them.
content.location: Up the hill from the "warm up" area, or as you come down the trail go straight at the cairn.  The trail will curve to the left (skip the right turn for the "swirly" boulder) and follow for another 200 feet or so past a few other areas.  At the top of a hill the problem will be on your right.

content.description: To the right of V2 My Ass, there is a tall blunt arete, this route climbs up that arete. The crux comes at about 12 feet when you need to trust a smear and reach high to a good sloper.
content.location: On the Pinnacle Boulder this is the tall blunt arete to the right of V2 My Ass.

content.description:
Climbs the face up and left.  Sit start with right hand on a big flake, left hand on a sidepull with good feet.  Bump left hand up to another sidepull, move right hand onto a sloping hold, and stand up to a painful crimp.  Work your feet up and (crux) grab a jug at the lip.  Topout.   

  Really good if you can deal with the sharp crimp.
content.location: On the backside of the Forgotten Boulder

content.description: Skipping the crux first move of Giving Up Skin for the New Year yeilds a fun moderate in the sun on the forgotten boulder.  Stand start, reaching high to the right hand flake. Left hand on any slopey thing you find, and get a high right foot to reach a fun series of sidepulls to a sloping top out.
content.location: Sunny side of the forgotten boulder

content.description: A tall, mostly smooth and intimidating face. Slab climbing on crystal crimps and interested features. Pray that your feet hold and work your way up the face. Super technical, but a V1 once you figure it all out.
content.protection: Pad, spotter is not a bad idea. "Pavement burn" is the most common result of a fall.
content.location: The face to the left of V2 My Ass, on the Pinnacle Boulder.

content.description: To the right of Giving Up Skin, locate another low start on a weird sidepulldercling and an decent edge. Make a hard move or two into more moderate climbing.
content.location: Â right of Giving Up Skin

content.description:
Obvious bald low-ball boulder on the right just before warm up area, by V2 My Ass. 

  Start sitting on the right on a nice jug, then move up and left using the super-hard fine grained slopers and the start hold as your only foothold. Keep moving left fighting the urge to poop yourself or fall (or both), until you reach the other jug wayyyy out left.  Let your foot cut and top it out.  Shouldery and slopey and worth a laugh. 

  Check it out in the film Uncommon Ground
content.protection: Pad, maybe two if you are short a spotter.
content.location: Just before the warm-up area on right. Just left of V2 My Ass.

climbs.name: Giving Up Skin for the New Year

content.description: Start with your left hand in a cool undercling pocket and right crimping a crystal. Find a foot (higher than you want) and lunge for a good edge up and right. Top out.
content.protection: Pad. Spotter if you're the nervous type.
content.location: On the Forgotten Boulder, to the right of Freezing Point Depression.

content.description:
Good hold.  Easy move.  Good hold.  Big move.  Bad hold.  Even bigger move.  Good hold.  Topout.  Woohoo.  A crimpy, powerful problem that starts and ends as for Freezing Point Depression without sharing a single move.  Sit start with the nice flake in the middle of the face and pull up to a left hand crimp in the horizontal.  Make a big move up and right to a crimp, before fixing your feet and pulling straight up to the lip. 

  To make the last move slightly easier, use a sketchy sidepull for your left hand and then pull up to the lip.
content.location: On the Forgotten Boulder, this problem is found on the back right side when approaching from the trail and shares a common start with Rio's Sharp Problem. Downclimb an easy face towards the trail.

content.description: Great holds, cool moves, and one of the better moderates in the woods.  It starts in the middle of the face, traverses to the arete, and then climbs up to a good topout.  Sit start with your right hand on the obvious flake and left hand on a good sidepull.  Pull off the ground and bump up to another left hand sidepull.  Pop a right foot up, then move left hand into the undercling at your waist.  Transition over to the right and bump out to a nub on the arete.  Fall into a sidepull with your left hand and fight the barndoor.  Slap up to a jug right hand and make a couple of moves to gain the lip directly above.
content.location: On the Forgotten Boulder, this problem is found on the back right side when approaching from the trail.  Downclimb an easy face towards the trail.

climbs.name: Embrace the Chaos (aka Branded for Life)

content.description:
A fun little problem that doesn't get much attention.  Sit start in the corner with your left hand up on a crimp/flake and your right hand on a gaston sloper.  There is a small left foot that will let you tension up and toss in a massive dropknee.  Move right hand up to the slot, rock around the arete on jugs, then follow the arete to the top.  Downclimb until you can hop over onto the top of Gran Torino. 

  This problem can also be done by pulling up to the lip on the left and following it back to the jugs out right, but where's the fun in that?
content.location: This problem is located on the back of V2 My Ass, in the tunnel right of the Gran Torino.

content.description: The climb directly to the left 20 Clicks. Sit/squat start on left crimp and right on the jug. Work up and over the lip using a crux crimp on to easier ground. Top out straight up.
content.location: On the Forgotten Boulder. On the left arete on the "slabby" side. Look for obvious jug to start.

content.description: A blunt arete littered with big jugs and good slopers, great as a warmup or a beginner problem.  Stand start with a left hand jug and a right hand on the grainy arete.  Follow jugs up with the left hand and follow the arete with the right.  Gain some deep holds at the top and finish it up.
content.location: On the Forgotten Boulder, this is the arete nearest the Warmup area, on the uphill side of the boulder.  The problem can be seen from the trail when walking towards it from either the Warmup area or the Pinnacle Boulder.  Downclimb an easy face.

content.description: These three boulders sit atop and beside a small hill overlooking the Warmup Area.  The one short boulder holds Gran Torino, while the other two are far taller and hold classics like V2 My Ass! and Freezing Point Depression.  Good beta and some better friction will go a long way on these problems.
